Term.definition: A numerical position of an item in a list or sequence, starting from zero in Python.
Official or community-written reference material explaining how to use a programming language or library.
A list of lists, often used to represent a table or matrix structure.
A built-in list method that adds an item to the end of a list.
Indicates that the boundary value is included in the specified range.
A number that has a decimal point, representing non-integer values in programming.
The process of generating unpredictable values, often using functions from Python's random module.
A built-in Python data structure that stores an ordered collection of items.
A built-in Python function that reads user input from the keyboard as a string.
A built-in Python function that outputs text or variables to the console.
Values passed to a function when it is called.

A diagram showing the sequence of steps and decisions in a process or program logic.
The set of rules and code that control how a game operates and responds to input.
A symbol or word used to connect two or more conditions in programming, like 'and' or 'or'.
A collection of key-value pairs, where each key maps to a value.
A way to access or point to the actual object or function in memory.
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task when called.
A group of one or more statements treated as a unit, usually defined by indentation.
Including the boundary values in a range, such as both 45 and 55 in 45 to 55 inclusive.
A function or feature included in the programming language by default.
Statements that perform actions based on whether a condition is true or false.
A named storage location used to hold a value in a program.
A sequence of characters, often used to represent text in programming.
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task when called.
A programming construct that repeats a block of code multiple times.
A Python keyword for 'else if', used to check multiple exclusive conditions in sequence.
A diagram that represents the sequence of steps and decisions in a program or process.
A reusable block of code that performs a specific task and can return a value.
A function that reads a value from the user via keyboard during program execution.
A value representing the sum or result of game actions, often used to determine a winner.
An error raised when an operation is applied to an object of inappropriate type.
A built-in Python function that returns the data type of an object.
A function that converts a value to a floating-point number.
A function that converts a value to a string representation.
A built-in Python function to get user input from the keyboard as a string.
An identifier used to access a specific value in a dictionary.
To run a program or code so that the computer performs its instructions.
Pictures or designs created using characters from the ASCII character set.
A built-in Python function that returns the number of items in an object.
A built-in Python function that reads a line of text from user input.
Text-based art created using characters instead of images, often used for decoration in console programs.
The process of finding and fixing errors or bugs in a program.
To analyze and identify the cause of a problem or bug in code.
Variables listed in a function definition to receive values when the function is called.
Values passed to a function's parameters during a function call.
A built-in Python data structure that stores an ordered, changeable collection of items.
A block of reusable code that performs a specific task when called.
A control flow statement that repeats code as long as a condition is true.
A named block of code that performs a specific task and can be reused.
A named storage location for data that can change during program execution.
An identifier used to access a value in a dictionary.
The data or object associated with a key in a dictionary.
A number with a decimal point, representing real numbers in programming.
A combination of values and operators that evaluates to a single value.
A control flow statement that repeatedly executes a block of code as long as a condition is true.
A control flow statement for iterating over a sequence such as a list, tuple, or string.
A built-in Python function that outputs text or data to the console.
A built-in Python function that reads user input from the console.
A statement used to include external modules or files in your Python program.
A built-in Python function that generates a sequence of numbers, often used for looping.
A scope limited to a specific code block, like inside loops or conditionals.
A scope limited to the body of a function; variables are accessible only within the function.
A scope where variables are accessible throughout the entire program, outside all functions and classes.
Errors detected during execution that can be handled to prevent program crashes.
An exception raised when an operation is applied to an object of inappropriate type.
An Integrated Development Environment (IDE) used for Python programming, offering code analysis and debugging tools.
The process of finding and fixing errors or bugs in computer programs.
The process of running a program or a piece of code by the computer.
Reusable files or libraries containing Python code, such as functions or classes, to be imported in programs.
The order in which individual statements or instructions are executed in a program.
Different possible routes the program can take during execution, based on conditions or logic.
A control structure that repeats a block of code for each item in a sequence.
A named storage location used to hold data that can be changed during program execution.
The blinking marker indicating where user input will be typed in a console or text field.
The process of finding and fixing errors or problems in your code.
A statement that executes code only if a specific condition is true or false.
A named storage location used to hold a value in a program.
Process of adjusting data display, such as setting number of decimal places in output.
A popular social media platform for sharing photos and videos.
A control structure that repeats a block of code for each item in a sequence.
Joining two or more strings or sequences end-to-end to form a single string.
A combination of characters that represents a special character, like newline or tab, in a string.
The set of features or behaviors a program or component provides to users.
Floor division operator; divides and returns the largest whole number less than or equal to the result.
Exponentiation operator; raises the number on the left to the power of the right.
Function that returns a random element from a non-empty sequence, like a list.
A Python library for generating random numbers and making random selections.
Randomly rearranges the elements of a list in place.
A variable in a function definition that receives a value when the function is called.
A value provided to a function when it is called, assigned to a parameter.
An exception raised when a variable or function name is not found in the current scope.
The process of finding and fixing errors or bugs in computer programs.
A Python data structure that stores key-value pairs for fast lookup and retrieval.
An operator that returns the remainder after division of one number by another.
The act of executing a function by specifying its name and required arguments.
